In order to stack the courts for generations, Republicans are dismantling a Senate tradition that ensures consultation and consensus with home-state senators. Through advice and consent, the Senate is meant to be a check on the president, not a rubber stamp.

Trump nominees have been incredibly young, allowing them to reshape our courts for generations. Nine of Pres. Trump‚Äôs first 15 confirmed circuit court nominees, or 60 percent, are in their 40s. By comparison, only one of Pres. Obama‚Äôs first 15 confirmed nominees was in their 40s.

While Pres. Obama‚Äôs first circuit court nominees were approved with overwhelming bipartisan votes, Pres. Trump has largely put forward controversial nominees outside the mainstream. 10 of President Trump‚Äôs first 15 circuit court nominees were confirmed with fewer than 60 votes.

With a Republican president, Senate Republicans are moving judicial nominees at breakneck speed.  President Trump‚Äôs first 15 circuit court nominees took half the time to confirm ‚Äî an average of 131 days ‚Äî compared to 254 days for President Obama‚Äôs first 15 circuit court nominees.

The facts are clear: Senate Republicans are stacking our courts with nominees outside the mainstream. After eight years of unprecedented obstruction of President Obama‚Äôs nominees, they are remaking the courts in record time. Our report:  https://www.feinstein.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/b/7/b783e2d9-38be-4798-a7fb-e89ff11fd47c/A233636E649CB9CD98B0555FB3D18C88.judiciary-dems-final-judges-report-5.10.18-.pdf  #CourtsMatter
